definition: variant of 譜系|谱系[pu3 xi4]
to connect/to relate to/to tie up/to bind/to be (literary)

sentences.english: Genealogy provide a methodological basis for Foucault's thought about the body.
sentences.chinese: 谱系学为福柯有关身体的思想提供了方法论基础。

sentences.english: From genealogical perspective, this article investigates the recent change of 1990s Chinese neo-poetry.
sentences.chinese: 本文从谱系学的角度考察了90年代诗歌的新变。

sentences.english: But it does lend some perspective to the genetic pedigree of the species and individual.
sentences.chinese: 但它能为这个物种和个体的遗传谱系带来帮助。

sentences.english: In this paper, a cladistic analysis was applied to reveal the phylogenetic relationships among the Nymphaeaceae.
sentences.chinese: 本文用谱系分支法分析睡莲科的属间关系。

sentences.english: Already, the discoveries have experts reworking the human pedigree.
sentences.chinese: 这些发现已经在令专家们重新修订人类谱系。

sentences.english: Where do you fall on the autism spectrum?
sentences.chinese: 在孤独症谱系中，你处于哪个位置？

sentences.english: Under the new system, those people would represent just one extreme of a spectrum.
sentences.chinese: 在新的诊断标准中，这些人只能代表谱系的一个极端。

sentences.english: This is a spectrum disorder with plenty of variables.
sentences.chinese: 孤独症是一个谱系障碍，变数很多。

sentences.english: This dog appears 3 times in the 3 generations pedigree of Dhara's dam, Ira.
sentences.chinese: 这狗出现在3代的的买的大坝，艾拉谱系3倍。

sentences.english: The famous drama Quyuan has a complicated edition pedigree.
sentences.chinese: 名剧《屈原》有较复杂的版本谱系。

sentences.english: Trail facilities are generally good and there is usually much information put forward as to the horses' pedigrees.
sentences.chinese: 场地设备良好，也会提供很多关于马匹谱系的信息。

sentences.english: There is a variability of symptoms, and a whole spectrum there.
sentences.chinese: 实际上，孤独症的症状差别很大，它是一个谱系。

sentences.english: Pedigree belongs to a sub-branch of history, which is actually historical archive.
sentences.chinese: 谱学属史学别支，谱系之作实为历史档案。

definition: to construct (often sth abstract, such as good relations)/to set up/to develop/construction (abstract)/architecture
archive of graphics (e.g. maps, documents or botanical figures)/atlas/collection of illustrations or sheet music
